__init__(path='')[source]

Starting main class for cryptocurrency tracking.

Parameters

path – string of folder path for specifying directory of blockchain databases folder e.g., ‘fulldatabases/’

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

adr_check(input_type, adr)[source]

Retrieving address data from adr_hash file

Parameters

  • input_type – Either ‘adr_index’ for searching with address internal index or ‘adr_hash’ for public key hash

  • adr – List of addresses to search.

Returns

DataFrame with address hash and index or adr.

adr_taint_search(target_adr, depth_limit=- 1, continue_mode=False, taint_limit=None, backward=False, case_name=None)[source]

Search for connected adr to the original and taint any direct address either forward or backward. specify depth_limit option to limit how many transaction depth to search but shouldn’t be used unless for testing

Parameters

  • target_adr – List of target address index.

  • depth_limit – DataFrame for public checking.

  • continue_mode – Continue from previous run. Will load from file with the same case_name.

  • taint_limit – list of two items [string to indicate for exclude during (‘taint’) of after tainting (‘after’), DataFrame of addresses for checking]

  • backward – Run the tainting backward instead of forward.

  • case_name – Name of the case used for saving into file.

Returns

DataFrame with tainted transactions and DataFrame with tainted addresses.

dirtyfirst(policy, tx_tainted)[source]

process tx_tainted to keep only full dirty, policy must be either ‘dirtyfirst / df’ or ‘puredirtyfirst / pdf’

filtering(tx_tainted, mix_time=None, filter_input=None, filter_output=None, filter_chain=None, filter_reuse=None, filter_mix_fee=None, filter_tx_fee=None, target=None)[source]

Filter fault-positive transactions.

Parameters

  • tx_tainted – DataFrame containing clustered adr for adding more.

  • mix_time – Maximum mixing time allowed, must be in timedelta64 format (e.g., np.timedelta64(3, ‘D’))

  • filter_input – Number of the transaction inputs.

  • filter_output – Number of the transaction outputs.

  • filter_chain – the first item is number for input and second is for output. Item can be none.

  • filter_reuse – Remove transaction with reused input addresses.

  • filter_mix_fee – The first item being the number and second item being the type of calculation (‘fixed’ or ‘percent’)

  • filter_tx_fee – The first item is DataFrame with transaction fee, second item is for filter transaction fee value and third item is for filter transaction fee rate.

  • target – DataFrame containing targeted deposit coin output (optional but required for mix time and mixer fee calculation).

Returns

DataFrame after removing fault-positive results.

haircut_distribute(tx_tainted, tx_input, search_df)[source]

Distribute tainted coins according to the proportion.

Parameters

  • tx_tainted – DataFrame to perform distribution on.

  • tx_input – tx_input data.

  • search_df – searching_tx from policy_tx_taint as it should be run in on going search.

Returns

DataFrame with tainted coins from inputs distributed to outputs proportionally

Note that it is possible for tainted coin to be so proportionally small (less than 1) that not all output can receive tainted coins

limit_search_range(option=None)[source]

Limit the blockchain data frame to transactions within the assigned time range.

Parameters

option – Same as limit_option in prepare_data

order_tainting(tx_input, search_df, this_index, taint_record)[source]

Assign transaction inputs with clean or taint classification for distribution later.

Parameters

  • tx_input – tx_input data.

  • search_df – DataFrame of transaction outputs of the current searching transaction

  • this_index – Current transaction index.

  • taint_record – The record dataframe.

Returns

DataFrame of transaction inputs

policy_tx_taint(tx_tainted, policy, test=0, keep_full_clean=True, input_fee_file=None, show_progress=False, continue_mode=False)[source]

Distribute tainted coins according to the policy/strategy.

Parameters

  • tx_tainted – DataFrame to perform taint analysis.

  • policy – List of accepted policy: poison, haircut, dirtyfirst/df, puredirtyfirst/pdf and variants of In-Out taint policy. In and out string can be in various acceptable variant combination, currently accept IN: f(first), l(last), t(taint), c(clan) b or h(biggest/highest), s(smallest,lowest); Out:f(first), l(last), b or h(biggest/highest) (e.g., FIFO, LIFO, TIHO).

  • test – Number to limit how many transactions to run, 0 means running until the end.

  • keep_full_clean – Keep transaction outputs with completely clean coins.

  • input_fee_file – Use transaction fee file instead of haircut fee distribution.

  • show_progress – Show progress in console.

  • continue_mode – Continue from the previous run. Will load from file with the same case_name.

Returns

DataFrame with distributed tainted coins

prepare_data(adr='', tx='', limit_option=None, save_tx_height=True, case_name=None)[source]

Search for transactions or addresses, and prepare blockchain dataframe. Then fill data into class variables: tx_output, tx_input and tx_height

Parameters

  • adr – String or List of either internal adr index or adr hash. Mixed types search does not work.

  • tx – String or List of either internal transaction index or transaction hash. Mixed types search does not work.

  • limit_option – None for full blockchain search, year number (‘2017’, ‘2015to2016’, ‘2014-01-01to2014-01-31’), numpy timedelta64 type such as np.timedelta64(30,’D’) will start from the first transaction found from the parameter input while list [np.timedelta64(10,’D’), np.timedelta64(30,’D’)] will start from 10 days after the first transaction and 30 days before the first transaction.

  • save_tx_height – Save tx_height as class variable or not as it is not used in the taint analysis process.

  • case_name – String of case name for file saving.

The process currently accept only either search by adr or transaction, not both.

tx_check(input_type, tx)[source]

Retrieving transaction data from tx_hash file

Parameters

  • input_type – Either ‘tx_index’ for searching with address internal index or ‘tx_hash’ for public key hash

  • tx – List of transactions to search.

Returns

DataFrame with transaction hash and index or adr.

tx_taint_search(target_tx=None, depth_limit=- 1, continue_mode=False, taint_limit=None, case_name=None)[source]

Search for connected transaction to the original and taint any directly connected transaction.

Parameters

  • target_tx – list of transaction index to starting tainting from.

  • depth_limit – Limit how many transaction depth to search.

  • continue_mode – Continue from previous run. Will load from file with the same case_name.

  • taint_limit – list of three items [string to indicate for exclude during (‘taint’) of after tainting (‘after’), dataframe of addresses for checking, dataframe of transactions]

  • case_name – Name of the case used for saving into file.

Returns

DataFrame with tainted transaction outputs.
